title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Friday 11 August 2017 - BBC News
summary: woman found dead at property in plymouth .
plymouth railway station murder trial date set .
two people treated for burns after fire in cornwall .
funerals for mother and son killed in a38 crash to be held .
exeter airport ranked 'poor ' for disabled passengers .
falmouth businesses asked to donate to grenfell tower victims .
selstar fireworks win national championship in plymouth .

documents.title: our live coverage throughout the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the week , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on monday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: boardmasters drawing the crowds to cornwall
text: across the two sites , 200,000 people will visit this corner of cornwall over the five days .
the music festival at watergate bay is sold out , so you wo n't get in if you have n't got a ticket .
you can get a flavour of it on bbc spotlight on bbc one at 18:30 .
much of the action at fistral beach is free though .
you can watch some of the world 's best surfers in action , skateboarding , and also see some great live bands , all in a beautiful setting .
i 'm told the after parties are legendary too .
have a great weekend !
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: the world 's biggest flip flop ?
text: this claim is unverified , but it must be close .
if you look closely you can see how the giant flip-flop also doubles up as a shower .
the boardmasters surfers are using it clean up when they emerge from the sea after their heats .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: north devon landowner refuses to let south west coast path be rerouted across land
text: ramblers say a `` once in a lifetime '' opportunity to improve the south west coast path could be missed , as a landowner in north devon is refusing to let it be re-routed across its land and closer to the sea .
lee abbey runs christian retreats and holidays on its estate near lynton and has told the authorities moving the path closer to the sea would affect its business .
the abbey trustees say the proposed inland route they 've agreed with natural england is still an improvement on the current coast path but not everyone agrees .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: the heats are on
text: the heats of the mens ' shortboard surfing are happening this afternoon .
they were supposed to be held yesterday but there was no surf .
the plan is for the quarter finals and semi finals to happen tomorrow , with the final on sunday .
it 's a bit grey and mizzly down here , but the contest continues .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather : showers disappearing and winds fading
text: it will be rather cloudy across devon and cornwall for much of tonight with patchy drizzle at times .
however , by dawn it should be mostly dry with some breaks in the cloud .
meanwhile , the winds will ease too .
minimum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
a cloudy start for many on saturday .
some will see an occasional shower at times but the skies will become increasingly sunny as the day wears on .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: putting the board in boardmasters
text: the watergate bay site is only part of the boardmasters story .
i 've now moved about 20 minutes down the road into central newquay , to fistral beach .
this is where the world class surfing is happening , with more than 100 entrants from 20 countries .
there is also live music , skateboarding , bmx and plenty of stalls .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: woman ditched eight stone after being shocked by a wedding
text: a woman who piled on weight after a childhood injury and started comfort eating after being bullied for her size has dropped from 19 stone to 11 stone and from a size 22 to a size 12 .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: tiverton family home after fire in council house
text: a family has returned home after a fire at their council property in tiverton .

the fire at a house in arnold crescent on 13 july caused extensive damage , and mum heidi wraight expressed her fears to council officers that it would be months before she could begin to rebuild her family 's life .
the fire caused 100 % smoke damage to 14-year-old tilly 's bedroom and 50 % smoke damage to the rest of the family home , with additional water damage from the firefighting equipment .

alongside a heart-warming response from the community , mid devon district council 's repairs team were able to arrange for a survey and full environmental clean , together with a temporary electric supply , to allow the family access to begin redecoration - they moved back in 11 days after the fire .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: traffic lights installed in bid to combat congestion in truro
text: truro 's threemilestone roundabout now has traffic lights as part of major work to combat congestion .
with 27,000 vehicles using the roundabout each day and new homes planned nearby , engineers have made changes to the roundabout and adjacent chyvelah road junction in a bid to improve traffic flow .
as a result , the overall size of the roundabout has increased and traffic signals have been introduced .

councillor geoff brown , cornwall council cabinet member for transport , said : `` our work at threemilestone is part of the wider improvements taking place at junctions along the a390 corridor into truro which are designed to improve traffic flow and tackle the congestion that has been a source of frustration for many . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: ever wondered what the inside of a vip section looks like ?
text: well somehow they have let me in , so i can tell you .
it appears to consist of lots of giant beanbags , people wearing hats and sunglasses , and a bar with absolutely no queue .
and some very clean looking , spacious toilets .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: music , music and more music
text: boardmasters was first staged in 1981 , and it 's grown hugely .
this year , there will be 50,000 revellers at the watergate site , up from 40,000 last year .
everywhere you walk there is live music playing .
it 's hard to find a quiet corner to make a phone call .
the main stage is heating up , with the powerful voice of frances filling the air a short while ago .
two door cinema club are headlining tonight .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: how about the media tent ?
text: continuing my behind the scenes tour of the boardmasters site for a moment , this is the media or press area .
lots of cables , laptops , cameras and people with their heads down trying to make their next deadline .
and there 's a little room next door where the bands come to be interviewed .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: the four giant 'pineapples ' on charles church are getting a £ 100,000 makeover
text: the council is replacing four giant pineapples at the top of charles church with exact replicas as part of a £ 100,000 renovation project .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: volunteers on hand with welfare support
text: if you 're feeling a bit overwhelmed at any stage , there 's a team of volunteers at boardmasters to help you out .
the welfare tent is near the main stage and is there to help people in whatever way they need .
`` yesterday was busy , '' said carolyn , who 's from torquay , and is an experienced volunteer .
`` people got a bit excited - first day nerves !
but today seems a bit calmer . ''
as well as people who are need emotional help , they also come here to ask about lost friends , phones , tents or even shoes .
and the unpredictability of the weather means they have a reversible board .
on one side , it advertises sun cream .
on the other side , ponchos .
ingenious .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: coverage of boardmasters on bbc
text: there 's plenty of coverage :
radio 1 newsbeat will be partially coming from here from 17:45 this evening .
at 18:30 , bbc spotlight will be filmed live at the bbc introducing stage , which is actually a very cool converted airstream caravan .
there are loads of great local bands performing across the weekend .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: passengers from exeter airport suffer 12 minute delays
text: analysis of flight data suggests passengers from exeter airport suffered , on average , delays of 12 minutes .
gatwick passengers have suffered the longest delays over the past two summers , an average of 27 minutes .
the airline with most delays to and from uk destinations was easyjet , with an average of 24 minutes .
the airport and the airline say many of the delays were beyond their control .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: more than 13,000 illegal cigarettes seized
text: more than 13,000 illegal cigarettes and 1,500 packets of illegal tobacco have been seized over the past year in cornwall , new figures show .
a joint raid between cornwall council and police in north country , near illogan last month saw another 1,000 pouches of hand rolling tobacco and a large sum of cash seized .

cornwall council 's trading standards said the products were either counterfeit , posing a public health risk as people do n't know what 's inside , or they had not had tax paid on them , robbing the public purse of thousands of pounds .

trading standards has received an increasing number of calls and reports from the public over the last year , and as a result ten search warrants have been executed and seven people prosecuted through the criminal courts .
councillor sue james , cabinet member for public protection , said : `` cornwall council has been clamping down on this issue and we want to send a clear message to people .
`` if you sell illegal products , chances are you will be caught and you could face serious penalties through the courts . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: festival drink delivery service
text: now this is a great idea .
picture the scene .
you 're at a busy festival , you 've got a great spot , but your drinks have run dry and it 's your turn to go to bar .
if you leave , you probably wo n't get your spot back , and you 've got the hassle of queuing for the drinks , and carrying them back .
enter the charity concierge .
they will jump the queue , get the drinks , and bring them back to you , all for a £ 5 donation to child.org .
christine cave is one of the concierges and said they will even set up people 's tents or carry their luggage .
they are here at boardmasters , keep an eye out for their purple uniforms .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'extended taxi service ' for one young man
text: billy and gail are enjoying a swift pint and a g & t in front of the main stage , with their 12-year-old son oscar .
he 's got a bottle of fanta by the way .
they 're here with their other , older , son , but he 's said his goodbyes and wo n't be seeing them until sunday .
billy explained : `` we 've dragged him to loads of festivals we like over the years , so now it 's his turn .
we are basically an extended taxi service , and a wallet for him ! ''
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: the damp and drab barne barton estate which is being torn down and rebuilt
text: a crumbling post-war housing estate is to be bulldozed in its entirety , as dozens of families prepare to leave behind their homes .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: rnli helps sailing boat casualties after vessel capsizes
text: as well as searching for a missing diver , falmouth 's rnli volunteers were called to three other emergencies on wednesday .
at 16:00 they went to the aid of a sailing boat near st mawes , with three people on board , which had capsized .
all three people ended up in the water , but were rescued .
at 18:45 they were called to help a powerboat that had run aground on rocks near the entrance to the helford river .
no-one was injured .
john blakeston , senior lifeboat coxswain , said : `` this has been a hectic day for all the crew members involved .
they have all conducted themselves in an admirable way where , true to the lifeboat traditions , they have carried out excellent work in saving lives at sea . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: boardmasters : 'we work tirelessly ' to make the festival in newquay work
text: the organiser of boardmasters festival has explained how his team `` works tirelessly '' to make the event run smoothly .
andrew topham 's comments follow two other uk festivals , y not and hope & glory , being cancelled this month .
he 's told newsbeat : `` like a lot of festival promoters , we work tirelessly .
we 're as motivated as anyone to make them the best possible experience . ''
y not in derbyshire had to end a day early because of extreme weather .
liverpool 's hope & glory was called off as organisers claimed there were `` safety concerns '' after thousands of fans were made to wait hours outside the event .
`` i can hand on heart say that with any of those festivals that have had to cancel due to bad weather , nobody would have been more devastated than the organisers themselves , '' said mr topham .
`` these guys put in year round work .
for many people it 's life long into these shows .
we do the same here .
we get one chance to run them each year . ''
author: BBC Radio 1

documents.title: anyone need a massage ?
text: if you ca n't get to the massage , take the massage to you .
that 's what biba and sue from mobile massage are doing at boardmasters .
tom and nick are here from hampshire , and making use of their healing hands .
tom said : `` we 've been surfing every day since wednesday , and were dancing all night last night .
it was a bit of a big one so our legs are hurting today ! ''
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: man tragically dies after collapsing during firework championships
text: a man has died after he collapsed at the firework championships on plymouth hoe last night .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: weather : generally cloudy with outbreaks of patchy rain or drizzle
text: cloud will lower and it will become misty over hills and parts of the coast later .
the maximum temperature will be 18c ( 64f ) .
tonight will be a damp and cloudy night , but it will become drier towards morning as the cloud starts to lift and break .
the minimum temperature will be 14c ( 57f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: relaxing with reggae
text: chilling out is high on the agenda here at boardmasters ' main music site at watergate bay .
the house of marley reggae stage in belting out some laid back tunes and there 's a queue for the hammocks .
in total there are nine stages , and hundreds of acts over five days .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: boardmasters : stage with a view
text: how about this for a view ?
this is the point stage , and even though it 's a bit cloudy today , the scene across watergate bay is enough to clear any mind .
roger sanchez will be on this stage later on .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel news : long delays on m5 northbound
text: cornwall

documents.title: crash leaves biker with potentially life-changing injuries
text: a motorcyclist in his 40s has `` potentially life-changing leg injuries '' after a crash on the a38 .
police are appealing for witnesses to the crash which happened between the weston mill junction and the manadon junction on wednesday at about 22:15 .
police and ambulance crews were called following reports that a motorcyclist was lying on the carriageway after a possible collision with a van , officers said .
the male motorcyclist was taken to derriford hospital by ambulance .
police are appealing for witnesses to come forward , particularly drivers of a white tanker and a blue box van .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: wet start for these two campers
text: most of the people at boardmasters for the weekend are camping .
these include hollie gardner who 's 26 from leicester , and emily thornicroft , who 's 25 from worcester .
they said : `` we put the tent up in the pouring rain .
the heavens opened and it was windy - it was very stressful , but now it 's all good .
`` we eventually dried out after about a day . ''
they are looking forward to seeing stormzy , alt-j and j-p cooper perform .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: getting busy at boardmasters
text: thousands of festivalgoers are pouring into boardmasters this afternoon .
about 50,000 people will be here at the watergate bay site where the main music acts are performing .
and there 's much more going on besides the music , both here and at fistral beach in newquay .
i 'm here for the afternoon to get a sense of what 's going on , and to chat to a few people that make it all happen .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: all lanes open on m5 now
text: spillage treated + all lanes now open # m5 n/b btwn j31 + j30 # exeter following broken down lorry .
long delays remain # a30 + # a38 , plan ahead
@ twitterid your not going exeter later are you ? ?
xx
author: Twitter

documents.title: major search for missing diver
text: a major search for a missing diver involved the rnli , the coastguard helicopter , cliff rescue teams and a number of private boats and yachts .
it happened in falmouth on wednesday afternoon when the alert was raised by a dive boat .
following an extensive search , the missing diver was found safe and well , after he managed to make it to the shore unaided .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: missing man last seen in exeter
text: police in gloucestershire are appealing for the public 's help to find a missing man who was last seen in exeter .
benjamin gardner , 28 , has not been seen since friday 4 august after he checked out of the mercure exeter southgate hotel .
officers are concerned for his welfare and are urging the public to call police on 101 if they see him .
he 's from cinderford in the forest of dean area and is described as being 5ft 5in ( 1.7m ) tall , with brown cropped hair and a moustache .
he was last seen wearing a green/brown knitted jumper , light blue jeans , round glasses and brown open walking sandals .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: woman who left hospital found in plympton
text: a 54-year-old woman reported missing from derriford hospital in the early hours of friday morning has been found .
police have been searching for nicola chaffe , from plymouth , who left the hospital at 00:20 .
police found her in plympton at 10:45 .

documents.title: estate agent 's nuclear impact zone joke 'poor taste '
text: an estate agent 's bid to highlight the best spots for property `` outside a nuclear impact zone '' has been lambasted as being in poor taste .
its press release included a map of blast impact radiation radiuses around the uk in the event of a nuclear war .
it was labelled as `` the worst press release ever '' , by a times journalist .
russell quirk , from essex-based online agent emoov , apologised for any offence , but said it was `` completely tongue in cheek '' .
worst .
press .
release .
ever .
# nuclearwar
a disturbing amount of research seems to have gone into this
i think they had too much time to play with the nuclear blast app/website and then had a ( not so ) bright idea .
i think that 's a fair deduction
not much research , whitby is only a few miles from raf fylingdales , a first strike target , house prices would be buggered .
missed off awe aldermaston too , imagine that would be high up on the list
looks at map oh , crap .
@ twitterid
whitby will become the capital and we 'll have to fight the seagulls in a civil war .
wan na move to dumfries mate ?
aye definitely
and then the `` agent '' has the nerve to say its `` a bit of fun '' that 's not what many of us are thinking , certainly .
might be the worst press release ever but still spent a good while considering which blast zone i 'd be in & if i 'd survive .
happy to be in the centre of rosyth blast zone .
life wo n't be worth living if there are any survivors .
just do n't press that button # trump
you 're probably right .
my mind struggles to even imagine the consequences .
it 's also bollocks .
our cities would be attacked in a second wave .
the first wave would hit military bases - which are much more spread out .
plus no ones going to strike edinburgh i 'm august .
unless you want to kill old people and students .
i dunno .
there 's a lot of people with grudges against the arts !
you could wipe out most of the world 's stand ups & every single improv group in one strike .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: exeter airport marked down on disability access 'for not consulting with users frequently enough '
text: exeter airport has responded to a civil aviation authority report which ranks its services for disabled passengers as `` poor '' .
only three others were rated poor - heathrow , manchester and east midlands airports .
the group says in some cases disabled passengers are having to wait up to two hours for help to get off a plane .

matt roach , managing director of exeter airport , said : we 're disappointed with our ranking because our service provision for people with disabilities actually scores highly but we have been marked down for not consulting with user groups frequently enough .
`` we have already taken steps to address this by setting up an accessibility forum and the feedback from the caa has been positive . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: tintagel artefacts 'show evidence of 5th century ruler '
text: archaeologists say artefacts found during a major dig at tintagel suggest the site could have been occupied by a powerful ruler in the 5th century .
tintagel has long been linked with the legend of king arthur .
experts say high quality pottery and glass means it was a site of importance .
it 's a place of major significance .
there were princes in the post-roman period and there would have been people with a lot of power living in this landscape .
they were able to command such trade to bring these exotic goods to tintagel .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: 200,000 people watch british firework championships
text: about 200,000 people flocked to plymouth last night to watch the british firework championships .
selstar fireworks from west sussex took the crown of the 21st competition in the city .
second place went to nemisis pyrotechnics , from cheshire , and smart pyrotechnics , from wiltshire , was third .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: former pm david cameron could have been bodyboarding in raw sewage
text: former prime minister david cameron may have been surfing at a sewage-polluted beach while on holiday in cornwall .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: five injured in car and tractor crash
text: five people have been injured , one seriously , in a crash involving a tractor and a car .
police , ambulance and paramedics were called to the a388 at hatt , near saltash , cornwall , at about 22:10 on thursday .
one woman , with potentially life-threatening injuries , was taken to hospital .
another man was taken to hospital with minor injuries .
three other people were treated by paramedics at the scene .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: plymouth railway station murder trial date set
text: the trial of a man charged with murdering a 49-year-old on the concourse of plymouth railway station will take place in october .
jamie skinner , 28 , of bodmin road , plymouth , will appear at plymouth crown court on 23 october .
wayne fenton , 49 , died in hospital following a stabbing attack on tuesday .
no pleas were entered and mr skinner did not appear in court at this morning 's hearing .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel latest : reports of accident in ivybridge
text: devon
cornwall

documents.title: breakingwoman found dead at property in plymouth
text: a woman has been found dead at a property in plymouth .
police were told about a concern of welfare for a woman at a property on union street at about 08:30 on friday morning .
the death is currently being treated as unexplained .
a cordon has been set up at the scene whilst scenes of crime officers investigate .
the woman 's family is being informed , although formal identification is yet to take place .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: coastguard sent to rescue lifeguard stranded on beach
text: coastguards were called out to rescue a stranded man on a quad bike on a beach - who turned out to be a lifeguard on patrol .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: motorcyclist , 20 , seriously injured in crash
text: a 20-year-old motorcyclist has been left with life-changing injuries after a crash at lee moor , near plymouth .
emergency services were called at 18:15 to the crash involving a red yamaha motorcycle on the b3417 .
the rider , a 20-year-old man from plymouth , suffered life-changing spinal injuries and was taken to derriford hospital by ambulance , police said .
the road was closed for eight hours for officers to examine the scene .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: two people treated for burns after fire
text: two people have been treated for burns and the effects of breathing in smoke after a fire in cornwall .
crew were called to a three-storey building in the copperhouse area of hayle just after 22:00 on thursday .
initially there were concerns that people may have been trapped inside the building , but firefighters found no-one in the block of flats and everyone was accounted for .
the fire , on the second floor , was put out by crews from hayle and tolvaddon .
an investigation into the cause of the blaze is under way .
author: Dick Straughan
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: 150,000 people in newquay for boardmasters festival
text: newquay 's boardmasters festival reaches its climax this weekend with 150,000 people swelling the population of the resort .
the event gives traders from cornwall and further afield the chance to reach new people and brings an estimated £ 30m in to the town .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: exeter airport ranked 'poor ' for disabled passengers
text: services for disabled passengers at exeter airport have been ranked 'poor ' .
the civil aviation authority has looked at accessibility at 30 airports across the uk .
only three others were rated poor - heathrow , manchester and east midlands airports .
the group says in some cases disabled passengers are having to wait up to two hours for help to get off a plane .
the airports have pledged to make improvements .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: water supply problems in manaton
text: tq13 9 : no water in # manaton due to a burst .
engineers onsite & aim to restore supplies by 13:45 .
further info :
author: Twitter

documents.title: selstar fireworks win national championship
text: pyrotechnic experts selstar fireworks have been crowned winners of the 21st british firework championships in plymouth .
their display was the final one on thursday evening .
two-hundred-thousand people watched this year 's competition which is worth an estimated £ 4m to the city .
one of the organisers , gethin evans , told the bbc future competitors can talk to the teams at the event and find out what 's in their displays and where they get their supplies from .
he said it means each year the displays get better and better .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: falmouth businesses asked to donate to grenfell victims
text: businesses in falmouth , cornwall , are being asked to donate things like meals and attraction tickets to help give survivors of the grenfell tower fire the best holiday possible .
a group of 45 are due to visit the town later this month .
the accommodation has been donated by local providers .
it 's all being put together by the group cornwall hugs grenfell .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: funerals for mother and son killed in a38 crash to be held
text: funerals for a mother and son who were killed in a road crash on the a38 near landrake in cornwall are being held later .
laura hopes , 32 , and six-year-old alfie , both from saltash , died in the crash last month .
it involved five cars and also claimed the life of plymouth man tony woodman .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: a sunny start but turning damp and breezy
text: there will be some sunshine this morning but cloud will increase from the west , and by lunchtime most places will see some rain .
however , rain will turn light and patchy this afternoon .
it will be a breezy day too .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f )
author: Bee Tucker
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel news : car stuck in middle lane on a38
text: devon
cornwall

documents.title: woman missing from derriford hospital
text: police are looking for a woman who 's gone missing from derriford hospital .
nicola chaffe , 54 , was last seen in the early hours of friday morning .
police say she may have headed across the tamar bridge towards cornwall .
she 's described as 5ft 4in ( 1.6m ) tall and wearing grey trousers and a blue sweatshirt .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel in devon and cornwall
text: good morning .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall throughout the day .
if you want to get in touch , please email us
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online
